name: nibbled
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
nibble
[ I or T ] to eat something by taking a lot of small bites: Do you have some peanuts for us to nibble while the party warms up? A mouse has nibbled through the computer cables. Jenny's hamster's nibbled a hole in the sofa.
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to chew foodchewMake sure you chew your food thoroughly.biteShe bit into the apple.nibbleShe nibbled on peanuts while waiting for her dinner to cook.munchHe munched popcorn throughout the whole film.crunchShe was crunching on an apple.chompHe was chomping a chocolate bar.
See more results »
[ T ] to bite something gently and repeatedly: She nibbled his ear.
